A loop is always closed. 6. **Create a 3D sketch** by transforming the 2D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 7. **Extrude the sketch** along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.0625 units to create the base rectangular prism. The base rectangular prism has the following dimensions: - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.1562 units - Length: 0.75 units (same as width) Continue to the next part to create the cylindrical hole in the base rectangular prism. Part 2: Creating the Cylindrical Hole in the Rectangular Prism 1. **Create a new coordinate system** using the same coordinate system as Part 1. 2. **Draw a 2D sketch** on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. 3. **Create a circle** by drawing a line from point (0.1875, 0.1562) to point (0.2499, 0.1562) and then drawing a circle centered at (0.1875, 0.1562) with a radius of 0.0625 units. 4. **Close the loop**. A loop is always closed. 5. **Create a 3D sketch** by transforming the 2D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the sketch** along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of -0.0625 units to create the cylindrical hole in the base rectangular prism. The final shape will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The final shape has the following dimensions: - Width: 2 units (along the X-axis) - Height: 6 units (along the Z-axis) - Length: 4 units (along the Y-axis) - Diameter of the cylindrical hole: 1 unit (along the Y-axis)</description>
